result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell J Schuler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mitchell J Schuler

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 8:41 AM 
Defendant Mitchell J Schuler in court.  Attorney Eric Caudill in court for Mitchell J Schuler.  Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Caudill indicates that an agreement has been reached, that includes dismissal of felony charge. 

ADA Witt needs additional time to review case, notes officer is present for preliminary hearing. 
recess: 8:44am--reconvene: 8:48am 
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance; submits unredacted victim impact statement, Court directs ADA Witt to e-file redacted version. 

Waiver of Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment occur: 
Mr. Schuler waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of not guilty entered

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " NO CONTEST " entered on Counts #2 and #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #1

On Counts #2 and #3, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--complete Certified Batterers Intervention programming
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores except for employment purposes
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no violent contact with Victim 1
--no acts or threats of violence 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges

Days credit for time already served:  3  days
recess: 9:10am
Third Party Letter re no contact

Pre-trial conference on July 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[MK] case called at 10:32am 
Defendant Mitchell J Schuler in court with Attorney Glenn Avena. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.  
Attorney Avena admits service of the Complaint; reading is waived.  
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
Attorney Avena verifies that the Defendant's address is: 152 N Main Street in Jefferson. 
recess 10:36am 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on July 13th at 10:00am,  (2) Preliminary Hearing on August 5th at 8:30am

Adjustment Number: 22A 117685,
Payable Number: 192173,
Receipt Number: 22R 010029,
Amount: $20.00
Adjourned initial appearance on June 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ml] Case called at 01:45 PM
Defendant Mitchell J Schuler appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (PD appears for bond-purposes only; Def does not qualify).  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court tolls the Preliminary Hearing time limits, maintains the Defendant's jurisdictional objections, and sets this matter over for an Adjourned Initial Appearance.

Att Rumpf provides an updated address since he cannot return to the residence. It is as follows: 152 N Main St, Jefferson, WI 53549.

The Court requires a $1,500.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with Victim 1
--no presence at the residence of Victim 1; the Defendant is allowed to return to the residence one time, with the accompaniment of Law Enforcement, to retrieve what is personally his. Any item in dispute shall be left at the residence and may be subject to the civil process
--maintain absolute sobriety

recess 1:53PM

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance (also Status of Counsel) on 06/24 at 10:30am with in person appearances
**JA note in comments - Preliminary Hearing time limits need to bee addressed at the next hearing**
